sourceDesc.p: This publication constitutes a remediation of the printed Inns of Court collection. Information on original sources for transcriptions can be accessed via the Document Descriptions.
For a full list of REED collections, editors, executive board members, and staff, please visit http://reed.utoronto.ca/people

prefixDef.p: Private URIs using the taxon prefix are pointers to entities in the taxonomy.xml file. For example, taxon:church dereferences to taxonomy.xml#church.
Private URIs using the gloss prefix are pointers to entities in the glossary.xml file. For example, gloss:histrio-1 dereferences to glossary.xml#histrio-1.

projectDesc.p: Records of Early English Drama (REED) is an international scholarly project that is establishing for the first time the context from which the drama of Shakespeare and his contemporaries grew. Founded in 1976, REED has worked since then to locate, transcribe, and edit historical documents containing evidence of drama, secular music, and other communal entertainment and ceremony from the Middle Ages until 1642, when the Puritans closed the London theatres.

mods:mods.mods:abstract: "Surviving Pension Books date from 1568–9. William Dugdale consulted an earlier volume, now lost. His Origines Juridiciales (1666) preserves entries from 1529–30 and 1550–1 (see pp 58–9, 74; see p lxxvi for document description). Financial accounts were entered in the Pension Book to 1582–3, and thereafter in Ledger Books. The library holds microfiche of the Pension Books produced in 1976 (skipping ff 234v–5), and digital photos of PEN/1/1 (Pension Book 1), taken in 2006 when the volume was disbound for conservation. The standard essential publication is Reginald J. Fletcher (ed), The Pension Book of Gray’s Inn (Records of the Honourable Society)1569–1669, vol 1 (London, 1901)."
mods:mods.mods:accessCondition: Use of this public-domain resource is governed by the Creative Commons Attribution-NonCommercial 4.0 International License.

mods:recordInfo.mods:recordOrigin: This MODS record was created using the Islandora XML Forms collection of Drupal modules.

div.head: ff 303–3v (15 November 1613) (Pension orders)
div.ab: At this Pencion it is Ordered that wheras at a pencion holden the 22 of Iune 1613 for the bringinge in of the Maskinge apparrell it was Ordered as foloweth that is to say, it is Ordered that wheras befor. the maske latly performed at the Court before his Maiestie it was by the Order of this howse as by the Orders of all the other howses of Court amongst them for them selves Ordered that the Maskers should after the performance of that service bring in ther Maskinge sutes wherby some profit might be made of them to ease the greate Charge which was expended and in great parte resteth yet vnpaid & wheras the Maskers of the howse forbearinge to bringe them in accordinge to the said Order it was after the severall aunswers of som of them recorded in Open Pencion againe & againe Ordered that they should bring them in by a Certaine day of this terme or els every one of them making default to aunswer thirtie poundes in Lew therof every of ther said suites having Cost the howse above a hundred Marks which they haue Contemptuously neglected and refused to performe albeit none of them did Contribute any thinge to the said Charge as also were allowed all other ther necessarie Charges expended theraboutes wherfore for asmuch as itt is not thought fitt that any gentlemen of this howse should make profitt of the howse in that manor in particulor as also that if the said Maskinge apparrell should not be brought in accordinge to the said Order ther must be a generall new taxacion of the hole howse to pay the severall debtes behind and vnpaid, Yt is therfor Ordered that every of the said severall Maskers nowe being in towne shall for ther said contemptes be presently Cast into Commons and put out againe & so to Continewe accordinge to the Order of this howse vntill they have performeperforme: for performed the said last Order and that such of them as ar now owt of towne shall performe the same Order at or before Hallomas Next at which tyme such of them as shalbe found failinge in the performance of the said Order that is to say as well those that are Cast into Commons and out againe as the others Ar then fourthwith expelled the societie for ther willfull Contemptes of the government of this howse and ther Inconciderat dealing and the generall wronges to every member therof |

Now at this Pencion the said former Order is fully Confirmed and further it is Ordered that forasmuch as the tyme is expired within which the same should have been performed that the said former Order shall neverthelesse by or before Munday nextMunday next: 22 November 1613 be performed or els the said Order shalbe fourthwith afterwardes put in execucion

At this Pencion it is Ordered that wheras divers gentlemen of this Societie hath not paid the severall soms of money taxed vppon them towardes the discharge of the Charges of the Late Maske, and by former Orders such of them as have Chambers should forfett ther Chambers and that they should be seised by the Pencion to the vse of the howse, and such of them as have noe Chambers should be expulsed, That if these gentlemen which have not hitherto paid ther severall taxes and money vppon them seised towardes the said Maske shall not paie the same before the accomptes vppon Saterday NextSaterday Next: 20 November 1613 to Sir ffrancis Eure knight that then every one of them Makinge default heerin shall have the said former Order strickly executed vppon them without any further delaye

At this Pencion it is Ordered that the execucion of [of] all the Orders here to fore made against the maskers for & towchinge the apparrell for the [Maskers] Maskinge is spared and remitted at this Pencion

div.head: f 304 (22 November 1613)
div.note: Admittances to pay, the debtes arrere for the Maske.
div.ab: At this Pencion it is Ordered that all the admittance money of this terme now in the Stewardes handes and all the admittance money to be paied vnto the Steward the next Terme shalbe paid to Sir ffrancis Evre by the Steward towardes the debtes Owinge for the Maskers apparrell and the Owld Steward to acompt to Sir ffrancis Evre and to paie him also what is in his handes

It is at this Pencion also Ordered that all money ffor admittances shall ffrom hence ffourth be paid over to Sir ffrancis Evre to be imployed ffor the satisfaction of the remaining debtes of the howse for the Maske till the debtes be fully satisfied
